required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autonomic Activity During Nap Under Hypoxia
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Normobaric Hypoxia on Autonomic Activity During a Nap in Healthy Adults (NAPOXIA)

brief_summary.textblock: Sleeping under hypoxic conditions can impair cognition and autonomic nervous activity. A short daytime nap can modify these changes. Here we propose a randomized, cross-over study to evaluate the heart rate variability during a 90 min nap in a normobaric hypoxic chamber. In addition, we will investigate sleep architecture, vigilance, attention and memory.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. 12.8% hypoxic condition
primary_outcome.description: Mean RR interval measured by polysomnography (ms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. 15.0% hypoxic condition
secondary_outcome.description: Mean RR interval measured by polysomnography (ms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean LF/HF ratio measured by continuous ECG

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean SD1/SD2 ratio measured by continuous ECG

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage pNN50 measured by continuous ECG (%)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean temperature measured by continuous double sensor monitoring (°C)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean temperature measured by continuous double sensor monitoring (°C)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Longest memorized digit series (n, normal range 5-9, higher is better)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of lapses (normal range 0-6, higher is worse)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 min nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean reaction time (normal range 100-500 ms, higher is worse)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of incongruency errors (normal range 0-5, higher is worse)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Congruent response time (normal range 400-500 ms, higher is worse)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Incongruent response time (normal range 600-800 ms, higher is worse)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Congruent accuracy (above 95% is normal, higher is better)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 90 minutes nap under normoxic (20.9%) vs. two hypoxic conditions (12.8 and 15%)
secondary_outcome.description: Incongruent accuracy (above 85% is normal, higher is better)

intervention.description: Nap in hypoxia chamber at 20.9% oxygen (36 m asl)
Nap in hypoxia chamber at 15.0% oxygen (simulates 2660 m asl)
Nap in hypoxia chamber at 12.8% oxygen (simulates 4000 m asl)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women
- Age 25-45 years
- BMI 20 - 28 kg/m^2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe, manifest illnesses in need of treatment
- Postoperative phases
- Acute and chronic infections
- Sleep disorders such as sleep apnea, insomnia or somnolence
- Altitude exposure (> 2500 m asl) within 6 months before enrollment
- Regular migraines
- Smoking
- Athletes
- Significant weight change within 1 month before enrollment
- Inability to understand significance and scope of the study
- Drug or alcohol abuse

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results of reported articles (text, tables, figures, supplemental data) will be shared after deidentification.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal.
